page.title: 18A GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content:
This area of the Wirral Penisular is a mixture of houses and countryside . Infact as far as the Merseyside conurbation is concerned this is where the houses stop and the country begins.
The houses themselves fall into three catgories -the groups of private houses built on a large estate with small gardens and small access roads,a large group of post-war council houses and the beginings of a very rural village with big victorian villas and large spacious bungalows.
Much of the rest of the area is farmland much of which is used for growing fodder crops particularly grass.Here and there are to be found market gardens.
